properties.description: A one sentence description of the Data Component. This should be sufficiently specific to distinguish it from other similar Data Components and must not be identical to any other Data Component or Supplementary File.
properties.title: Title

properties.description: Select "Yes" if you wish to prevent the public from downloading the files that you have uploaded in the process of completing this form.
properties.title: Publish Metadata Only

properties.description: A longer description (e.g. 1-3 paragraphs) that might be used as an actual abstract for a paper or article describing the Data Component. This should expand on the title providing more detailed information.
properties.title: Abstract

properties.description: Select from a list of subject keywords that identify the object when performing searches. Only add subject terms from the controlled vocabulary. As you begin typing the autocomplete functionality will allow you to select the relevant term to reduce typing. If the required term is not present, suggest the term indicating where you think it should sit in the hierarchy (e.g. provide its broader term) by sending an email to vocabulary@fba.org.uk . It is not necessary to add either the observed property or label entries that are present in the CSV file column headers because these will be added automatically as part of the publication process.
properties.title: Subject Keywords

properties.description: Select from a list of geographic keywords from the controlled vocabulary to help identify the object when performing searches. Only add geographic terms from the controlled vocabulary. As you begin typing the autocomplete functionality will allow you to select the relevant term to reduce typing. If the required term is not present, suggest the term indicating where you think it should sit in the hierarchy (e.g. provide its broader term) by sending an email to vocabulary@fba.org.uk
properties.title: Geographic Keywords

properties.description: Select from a list of taxa to help identify the object when performing searches. If the taxonomic term is not already present, you may enter a new term which will be automatically added to the live list of taxonomic terms. If you wish to include the taxonomic authority information, do not append it to the taxa name. Instead inform the repository manager of the required entry via email to vocabulary@fba.org.uk and it will be added for you, although it will not be visible at the current time.
properties.title: Taxonomic Keywords

properties.description: Individuals responsible for this work according to roles selected from the list. It is mandatory to enter at least one Individual OR Organisational Related Party, but not necessarily both.
properties.title: Related Party - Individual

properties.description: The institution with which the individual is associated at the start of the activity that produced this data-component.
properties.title: Associated Institution

properties.description: This email address will be visible to the public when the dataset is published. The email address cannot be changed after publication, other than by republishing the entire dataset, and the previously published version will still be present. It is optional.
properties.title: Email Address

properties.description: It is not mandatory to specify a corresponding author. If specified, only one author should be identified as the corresponding author on this form.
properties.title: Is this individual the corresponding author?

properties.description: Organisations responsible for this work according to roles selected from the list. It is Mandatory to enter at least one Individual or Organisational Related Party, but not necessarily both.
properties.title: Related Party - Organisation

properties.description: The time window within which the results are specified. This is the time window that contains all the time windows for each of the Data Components (Members). It is mandatory to have a start OR an end date/time, preferably both. If it does not have a designated start or end, then just leave one blank.
properties.title: Phenomenon Time

properties.description: Formatted as "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss". All components required.
properties.title: Start Date/Time

properties.description: Formatted as "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss". All components required.
properties.title: End Date/Time

properties.description: The time instant when the result was recorded.
properties.title: Result Time

properties.description: Formatted as "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss". All components required.
properties.title: Date/Time

properties.description: The period for which the results should be considered valid. For example, a result may be superseded by a new Data Component, so it may have a date after which it should not be considered valid. It is mandatory to have a start OR an end date/time, preferably both. If it does not have a designated start or end, then just leave one blank.
properties.title: Valid Time

properties.description: Formatted as "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss". All components required.
properties.title: Start Date/Time

properties.description: Formatted as "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss". All components required.
properties.title: End Date/Time

properties.description: Select from the list of terms to describe the broad environmental realm being investigated.
properties.title: Feature of Interest

properties.description: The supplementary file(s) to which you wish to link should be added and then the title(s) should be selected from the autocomplete list. The document should describe the object in detail. Entries for both internally and externally hosted documents can be entered.
properties.title: Documentation - Internal

properties.description: The document should describe the object in detail. A URL and its description must be entered as a pair in order to pass the validation for publication. The description should be a single sentence because it will become the text of a link. Entries for both internally and externally hosted documents can be entered.
properties.title: Documentation - External

properties.description: If entered, it must begin with "http://" or " https://"
properties.title: URL

properties.description: The design document to which you wish to link should be added and then the title should be selected from the autocomplete list. Entries for both internally and externally hosted design documents can be entered.

A URL and its description must be entered as a pair in order to pass the validation for publication. The description should be a single sentence as it will become the text of a link. Entries for both internally and externally hosted design documents can be entered.
If entered, it must begin with "http://" or " https://"
properties.title: URL

properties.description: A geographic region defined by four coordinates representing a rectangular bounding box in latitude/longitude coordinates. Note that a map based on these coordinates will be displayed as part of the published data, so if there are privacy issues, the map should cover a wide enough area such that the exact location cannot easily be identified. A web-tool that allows you to click points on a map and then view their latitude/longitude values is available at itouch map e.g. -2.958538, -2.918538, 54.343175, 54.363175. All four fields must have entries. When the data is saved, a map showing a rectangle of the extent will be displayed.
properties.title: Geographic Extent

properties.description: If relevant then describe the vertical (atmospheric or oceanic) extent of the data in units of "metres" or other units such as "hPa". Enter the value closest to the centre of the Earth in the 'Minimum Value' field. If any of the fields have entries they should all be completed.
properties.title: Vertical Extent

properties.description: Provide the URL of the Coordinate Reference System that has been used. If entered, it must begin with "http://" or "https://"
properties.title: Vertical CRS

properties.description: The protocol document to which you wish to link should be added and then the title should be selected from the autocomplete list. Entries for both internally and externally hosted protocol documents can be entered.

A URL and its description must be entered as a pair in order to pass the validation for publication. The description should be a single sentence as it will become the text of a link. Entries for both internally and externally hosted protocol documents can be entered.
If entered, it must begin with "http://" or " https://"
properties.title: URL

properties.description: This field is populated automatically with a solr-friendly date string.
This field will be transformed into the dc.source field and so allow all Environmental Data Archive (EDA) records to be retrieved in Solr
